intro: Eriocaulon longifolium f. viviparum, commonly known as the viviparous spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant is notable for its viviparous trait, where the seeds germinate while still attached to the parent plant. It typically grows in wet, marshy environments, thriving in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant reproduction and adaptation to wetland ecosystems.
